description: How to find out what personal information TfL holds about you

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["Under data protection legislation you are entitled to ask to see any personal information that we hold about you. This page explains how to make a 'Subject Access request' to TfL and how we use your information when we process a request."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}

In order to help us identify and locate your personal data, when submitting a request please be as specific as possible when describing both the information you believe may exist and its possible sources.

Data protection legislation allows us to ask you for further clarification where appropriate; and we will normally be unable to begin processing your request until that clarification has been provided.

TfL, its subsidiaries and service providers will use the personal information you provide to enable us to reply to your request and any subsequent internal review, complaint or appeal about its handling in accordance with data protection legislation our information access policy, and our privacy and data protection handling procedure.

On some occasions, we may need to share your information with associated organisations, including the Information Commissioner's Office, the Information Rights Tribunal, and other legal representatives for these purposes. We will retain a record of your request for up to two years after it, or any review or appeal, is complete - for the purposes of managing any subsequent correspondence and establishing and defending legal rights.
Please select the relevant option from the list below.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Oyster or contactless journey history"}

If you are a registered Oyster or contactless payment card customer, you can access your journey/payment history and other personal information by signing into your online account. Oyster card journey history is retained for 8 weeks after the card has been used, and for contactless payment cards, journey history is retained for 13 months.  Further information on how to contact us about your Oyster or contactless journey history can be found on our help & contact page .
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Taxi and Private Hire licensing"}

You can make a Subject Access request for your personal information held by Transport for London in connection with taxi and private hire licensing. The form below will give you guidance on how to make a request.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Taxi and Private Hire Subject Access Request form","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/tph-subject-access-request-form-2019-v3.docx","icon":"download","size":"DOCX 38KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Road User Charging and Direct Vision Standard"}

If you are a registered Road User Charging customer, you can see your journey and payment history and other information by signing into your online account. If you receive a Penalty Charge Notice (PCN), there will be two images of the vehicle on the PCN itself.

For access to other associated personal information held by TfL, in connection with Road User Charging please see the Subject Access request form below for guidance on how to request your personal data.  You should also read this form if you hold a HGV Safety Permit in order to comply with the Direct Vision Standard.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Road User Charging Subject Access Request form","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/road-user-charging-subject-access-request-form-2019.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 237KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Traffic enforcement and monitoring cameras"}

Please note that Transport for London (TfL) is only responsible for a limited number of cameras deployed across the TfL Road Network, which is made up of London's main trunk roads. See which roads TfL manages on our map .
Other on-street cameras in London are managed directly by other public authorities.
TfL's traffic monitoring cameras are not used to record images and our enforcement cameras are normally only used to record contraventions of traffic regulations as they are happening.
If you would like to request access to images of you or your vehicle that may have been captured by TfL's traffic enforcement and monitoring cameras please read the form below to assist you:

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Traffic enforcement CCTV Subject Access Request form","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/traffic-monitoring-cctv-subject-access-request-form-2019.docx","icon":"download","size":"DOCX 32KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"London Underground CCTV and body worn cameras"}

Please note that images from CCTV cameras in London Underground stations are normally only retained for 14 days, however if you would like to request access to images of you that may have been captured by London Underground's CCTV cameras please read the form below for more information.

Body worn cameras are worn by some TfL staff including London Underground station staff and Revenue Control Inspectors,  Revenue Protection Inspectors on buses, some Bus Station staff, Road Traffic Enforcement Officers and Taxi and Private Hire Compliance Officers. These cameras record audio as well as video images.

Footage and voice recordings from body worn cameras are normally only retained for 14 days. If you would like to request access to footage of you that may have been captured by these body worn cameras please read the form below for more information.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Body Worn Cameras Subject Access Request form","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/bwc-subject-access-request-form-2019.docx","icon":"download","size":"DOCX 35KB","image":{}},{"title":"LU CCTV Subject Access Request form","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/lu-cctv-subject-access-request-form-2019.docx","icon":"download","size":"DOCX 32KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"TfL's Customer Contact Centre"}

You can obtain copies of correspondence or recordings of telephone calls you have made to our Customer Contact Centre regarding any of the topics below. Please also read the form for more information on how to make a request to the Customer Contact Centre.

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Oyster","Contactless payment card","London Underground","Santander Cycles","Docklands Light Railway","TfL Rail","London Overground","London's bus services","Street management","Emirates Air Line","Lost property","Travel information","Journey planning enquiries","Visitor Centres"]}

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"TfL Customer Services Subject Access Request Form","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/tfl-customer-services-subject-access-request-form-2019.docx","icon":"download","size":"DOCX 38KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"TfL job applications and staff records"}

If you are a current/former employee of Transport for London (TfL) or one of its operating subsidiaries (including London Underground Limited, Victoria Coach Station Limited, Tube Lines Limited, etc), or you have previously applied for a job with one of those entities, please read the form below to help you request copies of your personal information.
If you are a current or former employee of Crossrail Limited or you have previously applied for a job with Crossrail, please email DPO@tfl.gov.uk for further advice.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"HR Subject Access Request form","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/hr-subject-access-request-form-4-2019.docx","icon":"download","size":"DOCX 47KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"TfL Pension Fund"}
If you are a current or former member of the Transport for London (TfL) Pension Fund, please read the form below for more information on how to request access to any associated personal information.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"TfL Pension Fund Subject Access Request form","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/pension-fund-subject-access-request-form-2020.docx","icon":"download","size":"DOCX 36KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Dial-a-Ride"}

If you are a current or former member of Dial-a-Ride and would like access to your personal information, such as copies of correspondence, or telephone calls you have made,  please read the form below for guidance on how to make a request.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Dial-a-Ride Subject Access Request form","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/dar-subject-access-request-form-2019.docx","icon":"download","size":"DOCX 36KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Bus station CCTV"}

Please note that CCTV images captured on TfL's bus stations are normally only retained for 30 days. If you would like to request access to images that may have been captured by TfL bus station CCTV cameras please read the form below for more information.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Bus station CCTV Subject Access Request form","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/bus-ops-cctv-subject-access-request-form-2019.docx","icon":"download","size":"DOCX 33KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"CCTV on London's buses"}
London's bus services are operated by individual bus companies on behalf of TfL. Any CCTV on London buses is the responsibility of the company that runs that particular service or route.

If you require access to images of yourself recorded by a CCTV camera inside a bus you should contact the company which operates that particular bus route. You can find this information on signs displayed inside each vehicle or on our Who runs your bus page. As images are retained for only a limited time, wherever possible please make a request within a week of the images being recorded.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"London Transport Museum"}
If you are a customer of the Museum and would like to request copies of personal information that the Museum may hold about you, please read the form below for more information.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"London Transport Museum Subject Access Request form","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/ltm-subject-access-request-form-2019.docx","icon":"download","size":"DOCX 246KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
